section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Municipality" means any municipal corporation in this State that is entitled to receive federal-aid urban funds.

"Urban area" means an area with boundaries fixed by the Administration that includes and is adjacent to a municipality or other urban place having a population of at least 5,000, as determined by the latest federal census.
There is a County Highway Construction Fund in the Transportation Trust Fund.
There is a Municipality-Urban Area Highway Construction Fund in the Transportation Trust Fund.

text.section:
In accordance with this section and Part II of Title 7, Subtitle 2 of the State Finance and Procurement Article, and with the consent of the Secretary, the Administration in any fiscal year may allocate from the Transportation Trust Fund:
To the County Highway Construction Fund, an amount equal to the amount of federal-aid secondary highway funds that:
Are available to the Administration from the Federal Highway Administration;
Are allocated by the Administration to the counties; and
The counties later release to the Administration for use on the State highway system; and
To the Municipality-Urban Area Highway Construction Fund, with the approval of the releasing municipalities or urban areas, an amount equal to the amount of federal-aid urban highway funds that:
Are available to the Administration from the Federal Highway Administration;
Are allocated by the Administration to the municipalities and urban areas; and
The municipalities or urban areas later release to the Administration for use on the State highway system.

section.section: The Administration may apportion the amounts in each fund.
Each county, municipality, or urban area that participates in a program under this section shall furnish matching construction amounts.

text.section: The County Highway Construction Fund, the Municipality-Urban Area Highway Construction Fund, and the matching amounts required by this section may be spent only for highway construction and reconstruction under rules and regulations adopted by the Administration.
